reviews.text: This is a great hotel. I've stayed here several times and always been impressed with the staff, the restaurant, and the location.
reviews.title: Wonderful service, convenient location, beautifully decorated!

reviews.text: Our trip was for one night and we did so after reading the reviews of another hotel in downtown Lincoln. Our room was spotless, the bathroom looked brand new, the restaurant was excellent for breakfast. We stayed on a Saturday night and even though there was a wedding party taking place at the hotel, all went well and the service didn't suffer. Regardless of tastes, this hotel will satisfy. We used the valet parking and found it to be easier than using the self parking.
reviews.title: One night stay, but will return!

reviews.text: The Cornhusker is an example of a (series of?) successful upgrade(s) of a solid original design. You can tell that it was built in another era of travel (the spiral staircase to the bar, the vintage "walnut look" 1970s red digit alarm clock), but it is a thoroughly pleasant place to stay. Rooms are large and comfortable (with new "cloud feel" mattresses, a good armchair, large desk (important for me), good drawer space, and thankfully no minibar to take up space). Climate control was excellent in my room. Halls are quiet, with new carpeting.
reviews.title: Solid old-fashioned American hospitality

reviews.text: But the restaurant has also kept the vintage "mood": the menu is extremely traditional and short, and when you have gone over the three or four steak choices, there isn't much else.
reviews.title: Everything's to like at the Cornhusker

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are invariably young (school was out), courteous and efficient.
reviews.title: Anniversary Stay

reviews.text: I was in town for the Oklahoma Nebraska football game, was able to walk to all the restaurants, night life, and the stadium. The rooms were clean and the staff was very helpful. If I'm up in the area again I would look here and also Embassy Suites and let the price determine my decision.
reviews.title: Great Location, friendly staff
Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: I stayed here the weekend of the Nebraska vs. Pittsburgh football game and was very pleased. The hotel has been totally refurbished and redone and was in an excellent location, close to all the downtown action and within walking distance of the stadium. The hotel restaurant was superb and the hotel staff was very friendly.

reviews.title: Fresh and clean
reviews.text: The Cornhusker Hotel has recently undergone major renovations from the guest bedrooms to the banquet halls and it looks positively lovely. As always the service and responsiveness of the staff is impeccable. Anyone travelling to or through Lincoln would be missing out dearly if they failed to experience Nebraska's "Grand Hotel." Plus- it's a Marriott property now so bring your rewards cards!

reviews.title: Do not stay here!
reviews.text: This place is not even close to worth the price you pay to stay here. I thought that paying close to $200 per night, you should get something nice.

reviews.title: Super nice!
reviews.text: This place is way over-priced. Save your money and stay at the Super 8 because it is just as nice there. Otherwise, go for the Holiday Inn or Embassy Suites!
Wonderful downtown hotel. Rooms were very nice and very
